communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I like to request any reports or records cross-referencing Mason Turner and Officer Diana Zeitz. Either reports that she has filed or reports containing both names.

There should not be any fees associated pertaining to this request as the court has already stated that audio and visual recordings are to be provided, I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment and/or download link as per Sunshine Law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. turner

title: SEC, Aug '22

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SEC, Aug '22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any warning letters sent by the SEC during the month of August 2022.

2. Any civil investigatory demand letters sent by the SEC during the month of August 2022.

3. Any letters sent to the SEC commissioner by a member of Congress or White House official during the month of August 2022.

4. Any letters sent by the SEC commissioner to a member of Congress or White House official during the month of August 2022.

5. Any FOIA requests to the SEC responded during the month of August 2022, and the responsive documents.

6. Any SEC OIG reports delivered during the month of August 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lewis Manning

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-02911-FOIA
communications.communication:
I'm interested in understanding the total volume and scope of official letters sent by the SEC that in some way warn an outside entity of their potential non-compliance with SEC rules. I'm not very familiar with the SEC, so I'm not sure how best to narrow the request.

Alternatively, would it be less work to provide all official letters (eg. written on official letterhead) sent during August 2022? That might be more interesting to me and require less filtering by you.

To reduce your workload, I'm happy to narrow the request however you recommend.

communications.subject: FOIA Request No. 22-02910-FOIA - response requested
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Manning,

We are processing your request for "[a]ny FOIA requests to the SEC responded during the month of August 2022, and the responsive documents." This request was assigned tracking number 22-02910-FOIA.

We need to request clarification of your request in order to identify the information of most interest to you. Are you interested in the response letters for just those requests where records were provided?

We respond to a high volume of FOIA requests where there is no information found and no records are provided to the requester. We receive between 10,000-13,000 requests per year, so our volume of outgoing final response letters for a single month may be 1,000 letters or more, including only interim and final response letters (not including acknowledgement letters, other types of administrative letters, emails, etc.). Further, these letters are only stored in each individual request file and would require an extensive manual search.

Depending on the information you are seeking, it might be possible to arrange for an alternative to the letters, such as a list of all requests that were closed during the time period of your request where records were provided.

Please let us know at your earliest convenience how you would like you proceed. We will place your request on hold until we hear back, and we would request that you please respond by Wednesday, November 2. We will be happy to work with you to determine the best way to provide the information you are seeking.

Thank you,
Carrie Hyde-Michaels
FOIA Branch Chief
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
Office of FOIA Services
hyde-michaelsc@sec.gov<mailto:hyde-michaelsc@sec.gov>
Direct: (202) 551-5816

files.title: Lewis Manning22-02910-FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #23-00001-OIG
communications.communication:
Hello Carrie,

Thank you for the explanation, and I'm happy to narrow my request to reduce your workload. I would prefer to have a list of all closed requests and any responsive documents. If that would require an extensive manual search, I would like a list of all requests that were closed with responsive documents. If that would also require an extensive manual search, I would like a list of all requests along with their final disposition.

Please feel free to choose whichever of these options is most reasonable.

7/4/2022 13:43 Teri Paul <sundog2014@yahoo.com> Creighton Wright <cwright@cortezco.gov> City council mtg

Please include all recipients forwarded through the system even if they did not reply, particularly any city emails :bcc recognized by the system. 

Ensure that all information:
1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

...is included where possible. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly. The law states, Section 24-72-205 (5) (a), C.R.S., (a) A custodian may charge a fee not to exceed twenty-five cents per standard page for a copy of a public record or a fee not to exceed the actual cost of providing a copy, printout, or photograph of a public record in a format other than a standard page; except that a custodian shall not charge a per-page fee for providing records in a digital or electronic format. 
2. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff. Please provide a quantitative list of the time involved and the staff who performed the tasks.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter

title: Keller Independent School District - Cancellation of 'The Laramie Project' - Second Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Keller Independent School District - Cancellation of 'The Laramie Project' - Second Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications to or from the following persons concerning "The Laramie Project": Superintendent, Chief Operations Officer, Chief Communications Officer, Area Superintendent (High Schools), or any member of the Board of Trustees.

"Communications" includes, but is not limited to, emails, letters, text messages, social media messages, chats, or other means of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

This request is limited to records generated on or after July 1, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: March 13, 2024 Texas Public Information Act request to Keller ISD
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

In response to the request set out below, please see the attached records.

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications to or from the following persons concerning "The Laramie Project": Superintendent, Chief Operations Officer, Chief Communications Officer, Area Superintendent (High Schools), or any member of the Board of Trustees.

Where required, redactions have been made pursuant to § 552.137 (Confidentiality of Certain E-Mail Addresses), Tex. Gov't Code, which provides that an e-mail address of a member of the public that is provided for the purpose of communicating electronically with a governmental body is confidential and not subject to disclosure.  Additional redactions have been made per The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), where a student's identifying information appears within the records.

Section 552.275 of the Texas Government Code authorizes a governmental body to establish a reasonable limit, not less than 15 hours for a one month period or 36 hours in a 12 month period, on the amount of time that personnel are required to spend producing public information for inspection or copies to a requestor, without recovering the costs attributable to the personnel time related to that requestor. Section 552.275 does not replace or supersede other sections, and it does not preclude a governmental body from charging labor for a request for inspection or copies for which a charge is authorized under other sections of this law.

Keller ISD has established 15 hours in a one-month period and 36 hours per 12-month period as the reasonable limit on the amount of time personnel are required to spend producing public information for inspection or copies without recovering attributable costs. This 12-month period coincides with the District's fiscal year, which begins on July 1. Requestors who exceed the 36-hour time limit in a fiscal year (or 15 hours in one month) shall pay all costs attributable to cost of materials, personnel time, and overhead expenses necessary to comply with the request, even if the requestor intends to only inspect the documents.  For the 2023-2024 fiscal year thus far, the District has spent 1.0 hour(s) responding to requests you have submitted to date (since July 1, 2023) and provided you with the records gathered and compiled as a result.

This concludes the District's response to the March 13, 2024 request.

Thank you,
Keller ISD Public Records
P: 817-744-1000 | F: 817-744-1263
www.kellerisd.net<http://www.kellerisd.net/>

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R013418-101223
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Washington State Patrol. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Revised Code of Washington, RCW 42.56. Your request was received in this office on 10/12/2023 and given the reference number R013418-101223 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

We understand your request to be seeking:  The most current copies of WSP Policy and Procedures Manuals and will not include individual desk manuals.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R013418-101223
communications.communication:
Hello Rhonda,

Would you please clarify what an individual desk manual is?

Thank you,
Rose

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R013418-101223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Good Morning, 
Desk manuals are usually kept for civil service employees like the Secretaries at district/division offices.  It will cover things like how to send a letter, how to set up an meeting, how to handle someone at the public window.  It is a manual that goes over that particular job duties.  There are other staff that keep them but they cover that position's job duties.  You may have some that are 10 years old that have never been updated or ones that have been updated in the last couple of months. It is not mandatory for us to have them but helps if that person leaves the agency to guide the incoming employee. 
Hope this helps, 
Rhonda Tucker, Public Records Manager

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R013418-101223
communications.communication:
Hello Rhonda,

Thank you so much for the explanation! I will not be needing desk manuals.

Thank you,
Rose

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 12, 2023. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Oct. 31, 2023. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #R013418-101223.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R013418-101223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Good Morning, 
Sorry for the confusion the date of 10/31/23 was the date given for you to respond to our clarification. The Washington State Patrol has so many manuals it is going to take at least 3 installments to provide them all to you.  Since this caused some confusion I will release an installment today and you will be notified of when the next installment will be released. 
Respectfully, 
Rhonda Tucker, Public Records Manager

title: Public Records Request - Business Insider (University of Alabama)

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Public Records Request - Business Insider (University of Alabama)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all guidelines, protocols, training materials, educational materials, and screening or diagnostic materials used by the university’s athletics department related to the prevention of disordered eating, identification of student-athletes at risk of developing disordered eating, and establishing a chain of reporting for a student-athlete flagged as at risk for developing or exhibiting symptoms of disordered eating. Relevant keywords to this records search include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder, relative energy deficiency, low energy availability, RED-S, and disordered eating.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $10. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees because I am a reporter for a widely read news site, Business Insider, and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of American universities’ procedures for assisting student-athletes at risk of developing eating disorders.

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available.

If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Alabama Open Records Law § 36-12-40 et seq.. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees.
Please produce these records in the electronic format and share them with me via email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible.

Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Hannah Beckler.

that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the
Alabama Open Records Law § 36-12-40 et seq.. I reserve the right to appeal your
decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees. 
Please produce these records in the electronic format and share them with me via
email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible. 
Thank you for considering my request. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this
request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of
the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if
not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 
Sincerely, 
André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Hannah
Beckler

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BCCed, by Patrice Andrews between 12/16/2022 and 9/12/23 which include one of the following keywords: "SoundThinking", "Sound Thinking", "Shot Spotter", "ShotSpotter", "contract", and/or "ShotSpotter performance." Please include all email attachments. Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Holland Disciplinary Records

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holland Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete disciplinary records of corrections officer Evan J. Holland and sergeant Jason M. Holland.

Citing the FOIL Subject Matter List of the Department of Corrections and Community Supervision last known to be updated February 16, 2021, the record would be listed under subheading "EMPLOYEE SUBJECTS" where this describes the following described records:

* Employee Investigations
* Executive Facility Files
* Human Resources/Personnel
* Labor Relations

Per legislation signed by the Governor on June 12, 2020, as Chapter 96 of the New York State Laws of 2020, these are now subject to release upon request through the state's Freedom of Information Law; records may not be withheld citing New York State Civil Rights Law 50-a (repealed).

Explicitly releasable are records including:

* complaints, allegations, and charges;
* the name of the employee complained of or charged;
* the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing;
* the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding;
* the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

Brianna White

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Alexandra Gelzin, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: F242786-040124
communications.communication:
Dear Alexandra: 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Office of Emergency Management and Communications (OEMC). Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: F242786-040124 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the most up-to-date version of the New Arrivals Mission Incident Action Plan.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foffice-of-emergency-communications-6313%252Fnew-arrivals-mission-incident-action-plan-161565%252F%253Femail%253DOEMCFOIA%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAUgKrPDOzkpVvOc_l8VxhL-TI%3A1rrV2i%3AZg6IJTLyopA57f7_SWwwih95kUC474eK4fAy-pKvhsY 
The Office of Emergency Management and Communications (OEMC) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

FFICE OF MERGENCY ANAGEMENT ND OMMUNICATIONS 
CITY OF CHICAGO 04/09/2024 RE: FOIA Request #F242786-040124 Alexandra Gelzin 161565-94615804@requests.muckrock.com MuckRock News, DEPT MR161565 263 Huntington Ave Boston, MA 02115 
Dear Alexandra Gelzin: On behalf of the Office of Emergency Management and Communications (OEMC), I am responding to your Freedom of Information (FOIA) request that our office received on April 01, 2024, wherein you requested the following information: To Whom It May Concern:" 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please provide the most up-to-date version of the New Arrivals Mission Incident Action Plan. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Alexandra Gelzin 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foffice-of-emergency-communications-6313%252Fnew-arrivals-mission-incident-action-plan-161565%252F%253Femail%253DOEMCFOIA%252540cityofchicago.org&url_auth_token=AAAUgKrPDOzkpVvOc_l8VxhL-TI%3A1rrV2i%3AZg6IJTLyopA57f7_SWwwih95kUC474eK4fAy-pKvhsY In response to your request, the OEMC is providing you with the redacted New Arrivals Incident Action Plan. Be advised, City of Chicago Employee email addresses, hospital names and personal telephone numbers have been redacted from the attached records pursuant to 7(1)(b) of FOIA, which provides that public bodies may redact information that is considered private.  5 ILCS 2(c-5) of FOIA defines private information as follows: "Private information" means unique identifiers, including a person's social security number, driver's license number, employee identification number, biometric identifiers, personal financial information, passwords or other access codes, medical records, home or personal telephone numbers and email addresses.  Private information also includes home address and personal license plates, except as otherwise provided by law or when compiled without possibility of attribution to any person. Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. "Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy" means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject's right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. To the extent a portion of your FOIA request has been denied, you have a right of review by the Illinois Attorney General's Public Access Counselor who can be contacted at 500 S. Second St., Springfield, IL 62706 or by telephone at (877)-299-FOIA. Email: public.access@ilag.gov. You may also seek judicial review of a denial under 5 ILCS 140/11 of FOIA. Sincerely, M. Mason - OEMC FOIA Freedom of Information Officer Office of Emergency Management & Communications 1411 W Madison Chicago IL 60607 312-746-9403

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any records documenting or summarizing expenditures related to the vendor Street Cop Training, a company that hosts conferences for law enforcement officers, between January 1, 2020 and Dec. 1, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

title: Crime Free Multi-Housing

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Crime Free Multi-Housing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years regarding "crime-free multi housing program" that will be referred to as “program” for the purpose of this request.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program  including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hi Jenny 
Attached, please find documents responsive to your request regarding the Saint Paul Police Department's Crime Free Multi Housing information.  An email search is in process and will be made available once completed. 
The Saint Paul Police Department does not participate in the eviction process.  This is a civil process of the Ramsey County Sheriff's Office.  You will need to reach out to them to get information on evictions within the City of Saint Paul. 
Thank you 
m. 
Molly K Casanova 
Records Manager 
TAC | RAC | NAC 
Saint Paul Police Department 
367 Grove Street | Saint Paul, MN 55101 
O: 651-266-5717 | C: 612-505-3369

title: City of San Luis Obispo Contracts With CAPSLO

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: City of San Luis Obispo Contracts With CAPSLO
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts between the City of San Luis Obispo and Community Action Partnership of San Luis Obispo from January 1st, 2020 up until the day of the completion of this CPRA request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: Sausalito Ripa Data

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sausalito Ripa Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records of any and all stop data collected by Sausalito Police Department for transmittal to the Department of Justice in accordance with the Racial and Identity Profiling Act, from January 1, 2022 through February 29, 2024. The records should be provided in an Excel spreadsheet or other delimited text format of electronic documentation that complies with the Interface Specifications of the Department of Justice. Cal. Code of Regs, Art. 5, Sec. 999.228.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Shinneman

communications.subject: Your City of Sausalito public records request #24-27 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Sausalito ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-27 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for your request. Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, Government Code Section 7920.000, et seq., (the “Act”), this is to confirm receipt of your request for records you sent to the City of Sausalito (“The City”).   Under Government Code 7922.535, the City has 10-days from the receipt of the request, to make a determination as to whether it possesses responsive records, unless there is a basis for an extension. You may email CityClerk@sausalito.gov if you have not received any response from the City after 10 days of submitting your request. Please note that the Public Records Act, the City is under no obligation to create or produce records that do not already exist at the time of request. The City will not produce records that are not subject to disclosure under the Public Records Act, and may redact records to protect non-disclosable information. If the City determines it is in possession of disclosable public records, the records will be provided electronically free of charge. Request for paper copies of releasable public record must be accompanied by fees to cover copying cost at $0.25 per page. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Sausalito.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Volusia Sheriff's Office Records Request :: M000369-032724
communications.communication:
Dear Bailey Pillon: 
Your request was received in this office on 3/27/2024 and given the reference number M000369-032724 for tracking purposes. Your request mentioned: 
"To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. any requests for proposals, proposals submitted by vendors, contracts, budgets or cost allocations for the purchase and/or use of aerial drones, UAs, UAVs, and UASs (hereinafter “drones”);

2. any policies, guidelines, manuals and/or instructions on department use of drones, including on the legal process required (such as a warrant or court order), if any, before operating a drone;

3. any departmental records concerning this department’s use of drones now or plans to use drones in the future including:

a. the types of investigations or instances in which this department is using or plans to use drones, or how it plans to support, manage or oversee the usage of drones by another department or office;

b. policies, guidelines, manuals and/or instructions on storage requirements or procedures for video or static images obtained through use of drones, including retention times;

c. the altitude at which drones can or do fly;

d. drones’ ability to carry weapons.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fvolusia-county-sheriffs-office-7559%252Fvso-drone-documents-161219%252F%253Femail%253Dcustodianofrecords%252540vcso.us&url_auth_token=AAAQIsWBpkyaDfWyo9fNLYCmQqw%3A1rpMSc%3AG4GMtNoGJt8BL5RMRBWKp5MY1mWr2d45nG2htZangfI" 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received. 
Volusia Sheriff's Office Records Section

title: Fair Workweek Letters for the Mayor

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Fair Workweek Letters for the Mayor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails and attachments received during the period 1/1/2018–12/31/2020 by Letterforthemayor@cityofchicago.org that contain the (non-case-sensitive) phrases "fair workweek", "fair work week", "fair scheduling", or "restrictive scheduling".

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Donrey v Bradshaw Usage (Reno Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any records that show the total number of public records requests your agency received between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023
-Any records that show the total number of public records requests your agency denied between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023
-Any denials of public records requests that your agency sent between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023 that cited Donrey v. Bradshaw as the reason for the denial
-Any records that show how the Donrey v. Bradshaw balancing test was applied in the records requests that were denied

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Capuano

communications.subject: Public Records Request of March 20, 2024, Reference #PRA-2024-05139
communications.communication:
Dear Nicholas Capuano, 
The City of Reno received the below records request from you on March 20, 2024 for records pursuant to NRS 239.0107. 
 "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any records that show the total number of public records requests your agency received between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023
-Any records that show the total number of public records requests your agency denied between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023
-Any denials of public records requests that your agency sent between January 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023 that cited Donrey v. Bradshaw as the reason for the denial
-Any records that show how the Donrey v. Bradshaw balancing test was applied in the records requests that were denied

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Capuano

If you have any questions, please contact the appropriate City of Reno records office listed below. 
Sincerely,  
  City of Reno Records Division

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Madera County Coroner

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Madera County Coroner
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Madera County Coroner's Office is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Madera County Coroner's Office is responsible for.

I research missing and unidentified person cases as a hobby, and I am curious as to why Merced, Fresno, Mariposa, Stanislaus, and other Central Valley counties report unidentified person cases yet Madera does not. I am curious to know how many (total number) and the circumstances of any cases in Madera - if they exist. 

Thank you for the Madera County Sheriff's Office for their commitment to transparency, and I look forward to learning this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Agency secondments

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Agency secondments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Documentation of all secondments that have been approved by NIST since Jan. 1, 2015. Secondments are agreements that allow an employee of an outside business, organization, or government agency to work with/for NIST, or vice versa.

2) All agency policies regarding secondments.

I ask that all fees be waived as I am a journalist and intend to use the requested records to publish articles in the public interest about the workings of government. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employ involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of it, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Inyo County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Inyo County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Inyo County Sheriff's Office is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Inyo County Sheriff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Inyo County
communications.communication:
Hi,  I searched our records and found 4 John doe deceased person cases.  I had zero results for Jane Doe.  I was not able to find any cases in our previous system.  Our newer system is dated from 2008 to current.  Thank you.


Wendy Stine,Records Supervisor
Custodian of Records

title: Krys Brandon Ruiz

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Krys Brandon Ruiz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any records related to the 3/28/2021 shooting death of Krys Brandon Ruiz (age 26) in Lompoc, California, in an alley between the 100 blocks of North H and G streets.  
- Any records related to the perpetrators, Mauricio Calderon and Andrew White, or suspected perpetrators.
- The e-trace for the firearm used in the shooting, or any other information about the weapon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Caroline Madigan

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Krys Brandon Ruiz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 25, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Ms. Madigan,

Please allow this to be the City of Lompoc’s response to your public records request received on March 25, 2024 requesting the following: 
1. “Any records related to the 3/28/2021 shooting death of Krys Brandon Ruiz (age 26) in Lompoc, California, in an alley between the 100 blocks of North H and G [S]treets.”
2. “Any records related to the perpetrators, Mauricio Calderon and Andrew White, or suspected perpetrators.”
3. “The e-trace for the firearm used in the shooting, or any other information about the weapon.”

As to item 1 of your request, the City will provide you with all responsive records by 04/08/2024. All the responsive records to item 1 have been reviewed by the City Attorney’s Office, and the following redactions have been made for the following category of sensitive information: personal private information of individuals involved, information that would reveal the identity of witnesses involved in the incident and any confidential medical information. (See be Penal Code § 832.7(b)(6)(A)-(C).) 

As to item 2 of your request, the named officers are not “perpetrators” of any crime. Please specify what type of records you are seeking for each of the named officers so that the City can better serve you. The request for “all records” related to the named officers generate a voluminous amount of records, and therefore, the request is overbroad. See Cal. First Amend. Coalition v. Superior Court (1998) 67 Cal. App. 4th 164, 166. 

As to item 3 of your request, there is no e-trace information available for the firearms.  Any information about the weapon used by Ruiz is attached to the documents.

communications.subject: FOIA#  24-00039-F    --Clarification Needed --
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Mr. Ciaramella,



I am the CSEMO's FOIA Officer. This email is to acknowledge receipt of, and clarify your FOIA request. CSEMO received your request on October 17, 2023, and assigned it FOIA Tracking Number 24-00039-F. Please refer to this number when communicating with the VA about this request.



Further clarification is needed before we can process your request. According to our regulations, a request for records "must contain a reasonable description of the records desired so that it may be located with relative ease." Per 38 CFR, 1.554(d), the requester's description of the records sought needs to describe such records in enough detail to allow VA FOIA Officers to locate them with a "reasonable amount of effort." To the extent possible, the requester should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipient and subject matter. Wide ranging requests that lack specificity or contain descriptions of very general subject matters with no description of specific records may be considered "not reasonably described."



Request



Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:



  *   All email addressed associated with any current political appointees, including alternate and pseudonymous accounts.



Clarification Needed: Please provide the information below:



  *    Are you requesting a list of email addresses for all political appointees, including alternate and pseudonymous accounts?



 We appreciate your interest in the VA. If you have any questions about this letter, please contact me using shawntina.cox@va.gov<mailto:shawntina.cox@va.gov> or (202) 200-7704.



Thank You



V/R,

Shawntina A. Cox

Government Information Specialist

Reasonable Accommodation Coordinator

Corporate Senior Executive Management Office

Cell: (202) 200-7704

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning or describing Ernesto Cardenal.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81701/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/81701/Ernesto20Cardenal2C20Nicaraguan20Priest2C20Poet20and20Revolutionary2C20Dies20at2095.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fernesto-cardenal-89471%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1jA58R%3Aj70cPHMEc8ROVzIX8frYT1rgUgo

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: ATL 311 Records Request: 225 Rogers St NE (Pullman Yards)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: ATL 311 Records Request: 225 Rogers St NE (Pullman Yards)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

List of any ATL 311 case related to the following search terms:
- Location: 225 Rogers St NE
- Property Owner: Atomic Entertainment
- Property/Business Name - any of: "Pratt Pullman", "Pullman Yards", "Pullman"

I would like to understand what metadata is available for ATL 311 cases.  To achieve that, I would like the following information:
- INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS, filtered to table(s) that contain ATL 311 cases
- Data Dictionary (i.e. column descriptions + context on what they're used for)

Until I have the above metadata, I'm not sure what is available for 311 cases, so here is a list of fields I need:
- Creation Date (when the ATL 311 request was submitted)
- Request Description
- Location (feel free to provide whatever fields apply to this: cross-streets, address, lat/lon, etc)
- Case #
- Disposition (acknowledged, rejected...whatever final state the case ended up in)

Time range: 2017 through present day (March 31, 2024)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brent Brewington

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Furby Information (National Security Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting information about the Furby toy. requesting all files in regards to the toy Including when it was banned in 1999 by the NSA, Navy Shipyard of Norfolk and the FAA

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian VanHooker

communications.subject: RE: [URL Verdict: Neutral][Non-DoD Source] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #113405
communications.communication:
Dear Brian VanHooker:
We received your inquiry for a status update on your case (Case 113405).  The NSA Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)/Privacy Act (PA) divison treats all FOIA and PA requesters fairly by responding to each on a first-in, first-out basis in accordance with federal regulations.  Each request is unique; as such, there is no set timeframe for this process.  Each case that has responsive records goes through three levels of review prior to the final response.  The length of review in each phase depends on many factors, such as the number of pages and classification level.
Please be advised that there are a significant number of FOIA requests ahead of yours in the FOIA backlog queue, such that we are unable to provide an estimated date of first level review at this time.  A letter will be sent from the NSA FOIA/PA division once a case moves to the next phase of processing.
NSA Freedom of Information Division
(301) 688-6527

title: Title IX training and professional development materials

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Title IX training and professional development materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-  "All materials used to train Title IX Coordinators, investigators, hearing officers, decision-makers, and any person who facilitates an informal resolution process" at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas -- as described by the Board of Regents Handbook, Title 4, Chapter 8, Section 14, Sub-section 13 (Recordkeeping, on page 42) (https://nshe.nevada.edu/wp-content/uploads/file/BoardOfRegents/Handbook/title4//T4-CH08%20Student%20Recruitment%20and%20Retention%20Policy%20Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20Policy%20and%20Affirmative%20Action%20Program%20for%20NSHE.pdf_
- All training materials distributed for the ongoing "Training on the Prevention of Unlawful Discrimination and Harassment" for all employees at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas
- All training materials provided to new students and employees on primary prevention and awareness training regarding "rape, domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault and stalking." Additionally, training materials on "safe and positive options for bystander intervention to prevent harm, including how to intervene in risky situations; the recognition of abusive behavior; and how to avoid potential attacks."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera

 You requested: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All training materials distributed for the ongoing "Training on the Prevention of Unlawful Discrimination and Harassment" for all employees at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas
- All training materials provided to new students and employees on primary prevention and awareness training regarding "rape, domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault and stalking." Additionally, training materials on "safe and positive options for bystander intervention to prevent harm, including how to intervene in risky situations; the recognition of abusive behavior; and how to avoid potential attacks."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-of-nevada-las-vegas-5507%252Ftitle-ix-training-and-professional-development-materials-161359%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords%252540unlv.edu&url_auth_token=AAAvj_4QBv6zHnXm8DZIi7UBBcM%3A1rr83h%3Av0ksIg1Hi7knCFInceFb5UPEaSXkB_VgEXINIitOddU" 
 
Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen

Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

title: CPS: Jarecki Law Group

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Jarecki Law Group
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023 through current:

1) Copies of all invoices from the Jarecki Law Group;

2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Jarecki Law Group. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.

3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Jarecki Law Group, including any modifications or changes.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15037

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015037-031824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
April 5, 2024 Miriam Bhimani 160717-57186405@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015037-031824 
Dear Ms. Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Since January 1, 2023 through current: 

1) Copies of all invoices from the Jarecki Law Group; 

2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Jarecki Law Group. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district. 

3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Jarecki Law Group, including any modifications or changes RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, private information contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including highly personal information revealing birth place/ national origin, and immigration status. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. The CPS FOIA Office has been informed that there are no records responsive to the portion of this request seeking “ letters of engagement” within the timeframe of this request. To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools
